column1: * Reflects an easing of more restrictive social distancing measures.

For purposes of this table, states were included if they mandated the listed actions. A number of states released guidance or recommendations related to the actions listed in this table but fell short of issuing a requirement and are thus not included.
1. Effective 5/14, AR made traveler quarantine mandatory for those arriving from certain states.
2. CT, RI, and WV have prohibited gatherings larger than five people, with limited exceptions.
3. The FL governor has prohibited gatherings of more than 10 people in public spaces, but limits on private gatherings have fallen short of a mandate.
4. Effective 5/18, residents are premitted to engage in more activities outside the home.
5. Please see links in Sources tab for more details.
6. All retail businesses can reopen with capacity limits in 12 counties where community transmission is not present.
7. Local jurisdictions are permitted to impose tighter restrictions.
8. Effective 5/18, MN implemented a large gatherings ban prohibiting all gatherings of 10 or more.
9. NE has enacted a large gatherings ban and bar/restaurant limits in counties where community spread has been confirmed.
10. NE has implemented less restrictive orders that allow restaurants to re-open with capacity limits in 13 of its 19 local health districts.
11. NY has allowed some non-essential businesses to reopen in 33 of its 62 counties.
12. A judge has ordered NY to hold its primary election, but litigation is still ongoing.
13. PA has suspended its stay-at-home order, reopened some non-essential businesses, and allowed for small gatherings of fewer than 25 people in 37 of its 67 counties.
14. TN has implemented less restrictive orders that allow non-essential businesses and restaurants to reopen in 89 of the state’s 95 counties.
15. While most counties in UT transitioned from moderate to low risk status, Grand County, Summit County, and Wasatch remain in moderate risk status.
16. Gatherings also limited to 50% of venue capacity if such limitation would be under 50 people.
17. Ongoing closures in Accomack County, City of Richmond, and Northern Virginia
18. For counties granted variance to move to Phase 2, restaurant operations may resume with limitations after meeting specific criteria.
19. All social distancing restrictions were lifted by a WI Supreme Court ruling, not a decision by the Governor.
